thread.title: Area Sports: H.S. cross country, soccer, middle school sports
thread.title_full: Area Sports: H.S. cross country, soccer, middle school sports

author: Staff reports
title: Area Sports: H.S. cross country, soccer, middle school sports
text: Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 9:30 PM Updated at 9:31 PM Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 9:30 PM Updated at 9:31 PM Cross Country The Kings Mountain girls and the Shelby boys emerged victorious at the Cleveland County High School Cross Country Championship meet held at Kings Mountain High Tuesday afternoon. Kaitlyn Moss of Kings Mountain claimed the girls’ individual crown by fishing with a time of 22:21. Justin Tucker of Shelby won the boys’ side with a 19.05 effort. Shelby led the boys’ division with 28 points followed by Kings Mountain with 40 and Crest 58. The Kings Mountain girls led with 23 points with Shelby second with 36 and Crest with 75. The top 10 boys’ finishers among the 46 competitors: 1, Justin Tucker (S) 19:05; 2, Austin McKee (KM) 19.24; 3, Andrew Gordon (B) 19:38; 4, Malachi Wingate (KM) 20.09; 5, Corey Lutz (B) 20:18; 6, Norris Fuller (S) 20.23; 7, John Benton (B) 20.24; 8, Will Blankenship (S) 20.29; 9, Joseph Waller (B) 20.37; 10, Christian Justice (Cr) 20.42. The top 10 girls’ finishers among 28 combatants: 1, Kaitlyn Moss (KM) 22.21; 2, Ladeja Anderson (S) 22.41; 3, Nicola Bridges (KM) 23.18; 4, Mariah Roberts (KM) 24.22; 5, Braydon Preston (S) 25.01; 6, Emma Ware (S) 25.15; 7, Conner Calhoun (KM) 25:54; 8, Caroline Foster (KM) 26.12; 9, Kassidy Hammrick (KM) 26.18; 10, Montana Smith (KM) 26.35. High School Soccer T.C. Roberson 2, Shelby 1 – The Golden Lions dropped a non-conference decision Tuesday. Caleb Goss has an unassisted goal for Shelby (11-2-1). Josh Price paced the defensive effort. Junior Varsity Shelby 2, T.C. Roberson 1 -- James Mabry had assists on both goals for the unbeaten junior Golden Lions (10-0). Noah Martin and Daniel Pate scored for the victors. Aaron Price led the defensive effort for Shelby. Middle Schools Football A pair of rivalry games are set for Wednesday. Shelby will host Crest and Burns plays host to Kings Mountain. Both games kick off at 5 p.m. Soccer Crest 3, Burns 2 – Thadeus Talbert and Jadin Merritt had two of the goals for the Dragons. Frank Kennedy had two assists and Camden Alexander one for the victors. Crest will host Lincolnton Thursday. Kings Mountain 2, East Rutherford 0 – Christian Quevedo and Tristan Stenger supplied goals for the Patriots and Josh Visoso provided an assist. Kings Mountain, now 3-5, visits R-S Central next Tuesday. Softball East Rutherford 9, Kings Mountain 1 – The Patriots trailed only 2-1 after four innings but saw East pull away in this Tri-County Conference encounter. By Staff reports
